intro: Conyza miniata, commonly known as the smallflower ironweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are usually narrow and hairy. Conyza miniata is often found in disturbed soils and can be an indicator of wetland ecosystems.
